required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of a New Aspheric Intraocular Lens.
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of a New Aspheric Intraocular Lens. A Prospective, Multi-Center, Comparative Study.

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the visual performance and occurrence of posterior capsular opacification after implantation of a new aspherical intraocular lens compared with a control spherical lens of otherwise identical design.

primary_outcome.measure: Low Contrast Best Corrected Visual Acuity Following Cataract Surgery
primary_outcome.description: Low contrast best corrected visual acuity (ability to distinguish objects on a similarly colored or shaded background) 3 months following cataract surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Low Contrast Uncorrected Visual Acuity Following Cataract Surgery
primary_outcome.description: Low contrast uncorrected visual acuity 3 months post cataract surgery
The mean photopic (day light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
The mean mesoptic (low light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)

Posterior Capsule Opacification Score (PCO), Density of opacification measured from 0-4 (1=minimal and 4=severe) and area of opacification measured from 0-1 (0=no opacification and 1=posterior capsule opacification required a treatment). Results (EPCO) were computer calculated by multiplying density by area of opacification.

secondary_outcome.description: High contrast visual acuity (ability to distinguish objects of contrasting color such as black on white) uncorrected and best corrected visual acuity.

secondary_outcome.measure: High Contrast Visual Acuity Best Corrected
High Contrast Visual Acuity Best Corrected

secondary_outcome.description: Uncorrected Low contrast visual acuity - LogMar visual acuity value
The mean photopic (day light) contrast sensitivity were to be compared between both IOLs for each special frequency (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
The mean photopic (day light) contrast sensitivity were to be compared between both IOLs for each special frequency (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
The mean mesopic (dim light) contrast sensitivity were to be compared between both IOLs for each special frequency (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
The mean mesopic (dim light) contrast sensitivity were to be compared between both IOLs for each special frequency (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)

Posterior Capsule Opacification Score (PCO), Density of opacification measured from 0-4 (1=minimal and 4=severe) and area of opacification measured from 0-1 (0=no opacification and 1=posterior capsule opacification required a treatment). Results (EPCO) were computer calculated by multiplying density by area of opacification.

arm_group.description: Advanced Akreos Adapt Aspheric Intraocular Lens (IOL).

intervention.intervention_name: Advanced Akreos Adapt in one operated eye.
intervention.description: Cataract surgery to implant the assigned IOL according to randomized schedule.

intervention.intervention_name: Akreos Adapt in fellow operated eye.
intervention.description: Cataract surgery to implant the assigned IOL according to randomized schedule.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have a clinically documented diagnosis of bilateral cataract (either cortical, nuclear, subcapsular or a combination) liable to benefit from standard cataract surgery.
- Patients must be undergoing primary cataract surgery with IOL in-the-bag implantation, requiring a IOL power from 10 to 30 diopters.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with corneal damage.
- Patients with any anterior segment pathology for which extracapsular phacoemulsification cataract surgery would be contraindicated.
- Patients with any ocular pathology, other than the cataract, having repercussions on visual function:

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment began on 12/15/2004 and ended on 04/28/2006. This study was conducted at 5 European sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Planned enrollment was to consist of 120 subjects, due to difficulties in enrolling subjects within the designated 6 month enrollment window 75 subjects were entered into the study for a total of 150 treated eyes.

group.title: Akreos Intraocular Lens
group.description: Subjects randomised to receive Akreos Advanced Optic Aspheric Intraocular Lens in one eye and Akreos Adapt Spherical Intraocular Lens in the fellow eye.

participants_list.participants: 69 participants - Akreos Advanced Optic Lens in one eye and Akreos Adapt Lens in the fellow eye.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Adapt AO implanted posterior side up

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: 69 participants (138 eyes)were randomised to receive Akreos Advanced Optic Aspheric Intraocular Lens in one eye (69 eyes) and Akreos Adapt Spherical Intraocular Lens in the fellow eye (69 eyes).

outcome.title: Low Contrast Best Corrected Visual Acuity Following Cataract Surgery
outcome.description: Low contrast best corrected visual acuity (ability to distinguish objects on a similarly colored or shaded background) 3 months following cataract surgery.
outcome.population: Number of participants 67 total with 67 eyes in each group, full analysis set, all randomized participants who had cataract surgery one intraocular lens (IOL) in each eye, and who had at least one baseline value and one post-baseline value for efficacy.

outcome.title: Photopic Contrast Sensitivity
outcome.description: The mean photopic (day light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
outcome.population: All patients who had cataract surgery and who have at least one baseline value and one post-baseline value for efficacy criteria.

measure.title: Photopic Contrast Sensitivity
measure.description: The mean photopic (day light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
measure.population: All patients who had cataract surgery and who have at least one baseline value and one post-baseline value for efficacy criteria.

outcome.title: High Contrast Visual Acuity
outcome.description: High contrast visual acuity (ability to distinguish objects of contrasting color such as black on white) uncorrected and best corrected visual acuity.
outcome.population: Patients without missing values for HCVA logmar at pre-operative and post operative at 1 month control.

measure.description: High contrast visual acuity (ability to distinguish objects of contrasting color such as black on white) uncorrected and best corrected visual acuity.
measure.population: Patients without missing values for HCVA logmar at pre-operative and post operative at 1 month control.

outcome.title: Mesoptic Contrast Sensitivity
outcome.description: The mean mesoptic (low light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
outcome.population: All patients who had cataract surgery and who have at least one baseline value and one post-baseline value for efficacy criteria.

measure.title: Mesoptic Contrast Sensitivity
measure.description: The mean mesoptic (low light) contrast sensitivity for each spatial frequency (cycle per degree-CPD) (1.5, 3.0, 6.0, 12.0 and 18 cpd)
measure.population: All patients who had cataract surgery and who have at least one baseline value and one post-baseline value for efficacy criteria.

outcome.title: Posterior Capsule Opacification Score
outcome.description: Posterior Capsule Opacification Score (PCO), Density of opacification measured from 0-4 (1=minimal and 4=severe) and area of opacification measured from 0-1 (0=no opacification and 1=posterior capsule opacification required a treatment). Results (EPCO) were computer calculated by multiplying density by area of opacification.
outcome.population: The EPCO score, evaluated by an independent observer using retro-illumination pictures, all pictures available. Measured in a 3mm and 6mm optic area.

measure.title: Posterior Capsule Opacification Score
measure.description: Posterior Capsule Opacification Score (PCO), Density of opacification measured from 0-4 (1=minimal and 4=severe) and area of opacification measured from 0-1 (0=no opacification and 1=posterior capsule opacification required a treatment). Results (EPCO) were computer calculated by multiplying density by area of opacification.
measure.population: The EPCO score, evaluated by an independent observer using retro-illumination pictures, all pictures available. Measured in a 3mm and 6mm optic area.

reported_events.time_frame: Ocular adverse events were measured over 24 month study period.

group.title: Akreos Advanced Intraocular Lenses
group.description: Akreos Advanced Optic Aspheric Intraocular Lens in one eye and Akreos Adapt Spherical Intraocular Lens in the fellow eye.

group.title: Akreos Adapt Intraocular Lens

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
